title: Is Swearing Allowed in Roblox Voice Chats?

steps.title: Swearing is prohibited in all chats except in restricted experiences.
steps.content: Swearing is prohibited in all chats except in restricted experiences. Roblox Terms of Service prohibits the use of strong language, which it defines as anything vulgar or obscene. This includes all forms of swearing. The only exceptions are experiences marked as 17+ in which the developer allows swearing in the chats. [1] X Research source Even if a developer allows you to swear in a 17+ experience, the rules against bullying, harassment, hate speech, incitement to violence, and strong sexual language still apply. For example, shouting an expletive after a jump scare or after an ambush would be allowed. Calling another player an expletive would not be allowed.

steps.title: Yes, you may be banned in some circumstances.
steps.content: Yes, you may be banned in some circumstances. The consequences for violating Roblox's no-swearing rules vary depending on the severity of the situation. You may receive a warning, or you may receive a temporary suspension. For repeat offenders, or in extreme cases involving harassment, bullying, hate speech, incitement to violence, or sexually explicit language, your account may be banned . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Log in at https://www.roblox.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Log in at https://www.roblox.com/ in a web browser. In order to join 17+ experiences in Roblox , you must be 17 or older and you need to get your age verified. You will need to submit an ID in order to verify your age. Log in to your account in a web browser. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Gear icon.
steps.content: Click the Gear icon. It's in the upper-right corner. This opens the Settings menu.

steps.title: Click the Account Info tab.
steps.content: Click the Account Info tab. It's in the menu bar to the left.

steps.title: Click Verify my Age.
steps.content: Click Verify my Age . It's below your birthday in the "Personal" section. This will display a pop-up window.

steps.title: Scan the QR code.
steps.content: Scan the QR code. Use the Camera app on your smartphone to scan the QR code on your computer screen. This will open a new window on your smartphone.

steps.title: Tap Begin verifying.
steps.content: Tap Begin verifying . This will start the verification process.

steps.title: Tap Start Session.
steps.content: Tap Start Session . This starts your camera on your phone. You may be asked to allow your camera access. If so, tap Allow .

steps.title: Scan your ID.
steps.content: Scan your ID. Use the camera on your phone to scan your ID. Roblox will automatically detect what type of ID it is. If there is a barcode on the back of your ID, be sure to get a picture of the back of your ID as well.

steps.title: Take a selfie.
steps.content: Take a selfie. Next, you will be asked to take a selfie. This is to verify that you are who you are in your ID.

steps.title: Wait for approval.
steps.content: Wait for approval. It may take a few minutes for your account verification to be approved. You will be informed if you passed or failed your account verification in real-time during your original Roblox session.

steps.title: Go to https://create.roblox.com/ in a web browser and log in.
steps.content: Go to https://create.roblox.com/ in a web browser and log in. If you are a developer creating a 17+ experience, swearing will only be allowed in the chats if you enable it in the Creator Hub. Go to the Creator Hub website and log in.

steps.title: Click the Dashboard tab.
steps.content: Click the Dashboard tab. It's the first tab at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click Audience.
steps.content: Click Audience . It's in the menu bar to the left. This expands the menu below "Audience."

steps.title: Click Communication settings.
steps.content: Click Communication settings . It's the second option below "Audience" in the menu bar to the left.

steps.title: Click the toggle switch next to "Allow Strong Language."
steps.content: Click the toggle switch next to "Allow Strong Language." This will allow swearing in both the voice chat and text chat.

steps.title: Click Save Changes.
steps.content: Click Save Changes . It's the button below the line at the bottom of the menu. This saves the changes you have made.
